alert.note: Alert for Allen; Simpson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 5:38AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SIMPSON AND SOUTHWESTERN ALLEN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM CDT... At 438 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Portland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fleet, New Roe, Clare, Geddes, Mcelroy Ford, Adolphus, Peden Mill, Petroleum, Alonzo and Forest Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
